org.magnos.net
Interface Server

All Superinterfaces:
Adapter
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractServer, TcpServer, TcpServer, UdpServer
public interface Server
extends Adapter

A server is created by a pipeline and listens on a port to accept clients.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Field Summary
static int Accepting
          The server is in an accepting state.
static int Closed
          The server is closed and no longer binded to the port it was listening to and cannot accept clients.
static int Disconnecting
          The server is currently trying to disconnect.
 
Method Summary
 void addListener(ServerListener listener)
          Adds a listener to this server.
 void close()
          Closes this server immediately.
 void disconnect()
          Disconnects this server by telling to to disconnect all clients and to cease accepting any new clients.
 Acceptor getAcceptor()
          Returns the acceptor that handles this server.
 java.net.SocketAddress getAddress()
          The address the server is binded on and listening to.
 ClientListener getClientListener()
          Returns the default ClientListener to add to accepted clients.
 java.util.Set<Client> getClients()
          Returns the set of open clients accepted by this server.
 java.util.List<ServerListener> getListeners()
          Returns the list of listeners of events on this server.
 Pipeline getPipeline()
          The pipeline that created the server.
 Selector getSelector()
          Returns the selector the server uses to create workers for accepted clients.
 java.lang.Object getSocket()
          The Socket of the server, This may be many different things according to the server implementation.
 boolean isClosed()
          Returns whether this server has been closed.

          Returns whether this server is currently disconnecting.

          Returns the current state of this server.
 
Methods inherited from interface org.magnos.net.Adapter
handleAccept, handleConnect, handleRead, handleWrite
 

Field Detail

Accepting

static final int Accepting
The server is in an accepting state.

Disconnecting

static final int Disconnecting
The server is currently trying to disconnect. In this state the server will not accept any more clients.

Closed

static final int Closed
The server is closed and no longer binded to the port it was listening to and cannot accept clients.

Method Detail

listen

boolean listen(int port)
Listens to the provided port.

Parameters:
port - The port to listen to.
Returns:
True if the server is now listening on this port.

listen

boolean listen(java.net.SocketAddress address)
Listens on the provided SocketAddress.

Parameters:
address - The address to listen on.
Returns:
True if the server is now listening on this address.

getPipeline

Pipeline getPipeline()
The pipeline that created the server.

Returns:
The reference to the pipeline.

getAcceptor

Acceptor getAcceptor()
Returns the acceptor that handles this server.

Returns:
The reference to the acceptor that handles this server.

getAddress

java.net.SocketAddress getAddress()
The address the server is binded on and listening to.

Returns:
The reference to the address the server is listening on.

getSocket

java.lang.Object getSocket()
The Socket of the server, This may be many different things according to the server implementation.

Returns:
The reference to the socket object the server is accepting on.

state

org.magnos.util.State state()
Returns the current state of this server. This is controlled internally and should not be modified externally.

Returns:
The reference to the server's state.

isClosed

boolean isClosed()
Returns whether this server has been closed.

Returns:
True if the server is closed, otherwise false.

close

void close()
Closes this server immediately. This will close all clients connected to this server, deallocate all associated resources, and close any open sockets.

isDisconnecting

boolean isDisconnecting()
Returns whether this server is currently disconnecting. If this server is disconnecting the server will close once all clients have successfully disconnected. When disconnecting a server will not accept any more clients.

Returns:
True if the server is disconnecting, otherwise false.

disconnect

void disconnect()
Disconnects this server by telling to to disconnect all clients and to cease accepting any new clients.

getClients

java.util.Set<Client> getClients()
Returns the set of open clients accepted by this server. This set should not be modified and is not thread-safe and should only be used for iterative purposes.

Returns:
The reference to the set of clients connected to this server.
See Also:
ConcurrentSet

addListener

void addListener(ServerListener listener)
Adds a listener to this server.

Parameters:
listener - The listener to add to this server.

getListeners

java.util.List<ServerListener> getListeners()
Returns the list of listeners of events on this server. Listeners can be directly added to this list.

Returns:
The reference to the list of listeners.

getClientListener

ClientListener getClientListener()
Returns the default ClientListener to add to accepted clients. If this is null then no ClientListener will be added to the client.

Returns:
The reference to the default ClientListener.

setClientListener

void setClientListener(ClientListener listener)
Sets the default ClientListener to add to accepted clients. If this is null then no ClientListener will be added to the client.

Parameters:
listener - The new default ClientListener.

getSelector

Selector getSelector()
Returns the selector the server uses to create workers for accepted clients.

Returns:
The reference to the selector used by the server.

setSelector

void setSelector(Selector selector)
Sets the selector the server uses to create workers for accepted clients.

Parameters:
selector - The selector to use to create workers for accepted clients.
